activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen A. Bock

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
09:00 AM Judge Mary Roth Burns presiding with Judge Michael Bloom. Defendant Karen A. Bock in court. Attorney Adam J Snavely in court for Karen A. Bock. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF92 & 22FO690. Snavely states Judge Burns represented Defendant in the past. Judge Burns states she will not take over case - will remain Branch II case. Snavely willing to proceed. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Snavely willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 09:04 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
